newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danisco damps Danish shares but support seen.
newsitem.headline: Danisco damps Danish shares but support seen.

text.p: For the second day running falls in Danisco weighed down the Danish KFX index but dealers believed the slide had reached bottom.

The food and beverage maker fell 14 crowns, to 400.00 after annual results on Wednesday in which it scored strong 1996/97 profit growth but said the rate of increase was likely to be less over the next 12 months.
It did not say by how much.
"Technically it looks as if there is support at 400.00 so I don't see why the KFX can't end the week at this level," a dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index fell 0.77 point -- 0.45 percent -- to 171.23 in overall bourse turnover of 1.5 billion crowns.
The KFX August future fell 0.10 point to 172.50 with 10 contracts each worth 100,000 crowns traded.
Other than Danisco top 20 share movements were relatively minor.
Ten shares fell and six rose, among them the top two banks. Den Danske moved a crown up to 640.00 and BG Bank rose three crowns to 351.00. Third-placed Unidanmark fell three crowns, to 372.00.
